column1: This page is a '''list of books in Tolkien's library'''
column3: books and other publications known to have been owned by [[J.R.R. Tolkien]].

column2: his library passed to his son and literary executor
column3: [[Christopher Tolkien]]. Before moving to France in 1975
column4: Christopher donated some books to Oxford libraries
column5: and others were weeded out and entered the used book market.

column1: A local bookseller bought a large quantity of the books and put  stickers with ‘‘From the Library of J.R.R. Tolkien.’’
column2: on many of the unsigned volumes in order to preserve their provenance before selling them off.

column1: Around three hundred volumes were donated to the English Faculty Library and  forty-five
column2: were also deposited in the Bodleian Library with Tolkien’s papers. <ref> [[Douglas A. Anderson]]
column5: in ''[[J.R.R. Tolkien Encyclopedia: Scholarship and Critical Assessment]]'' (pp. 361-2)</ref>

column1: *Description: Original cloth. Signed in ink on the end paper.<ref name=Rare>{{webcite|author=|articleurl=http://www.tolkienlibrary.com/tolkien-book-store/CLP0190E.htm|articlename=Altschwedische Grammatik

given to me by Rev. S H Scott
in the old 'Newman Bookshop'
at that time in Beaumont

Tolkien buys a copy of ''[[Wikipedia:Chambers Dictionary|Chambers's Etymological Dictionary]]''. In [[1973]] he added the following note in the book: "the beginning of my interest in German Philology (& Philol in general)".<ref>{{CG|C}}
Parts I-IV. Contains [[Manuscript notes in Dictionary in Englysshe and Welshe|a page of manuscript notes]] by Tolkien.<ref name=TW>[[Carl Phelpstead]]

column1: *"Tolkien bought this from Blackwell's Booksellers in Oxford (their label is on the inside of the cover) to study. As an ex libris Tolkien signed this book at the top of the first page. Inside the books are seven annotations in pencil in the margins (usually corrections!). Tolkien donated this book to the U.S. Catholic University."<ref name=TolkienShop>{{webcite|author=|articleurl=http://www.tolkienshop.com/contents/en-uk/d228.html|articlename=Tolkien autographs|dated=|website=[http://www.tolkienshop.com/ TolkienShop.com]|accessed=22 October 2013}}</ref>

column1: *Description: Tolkien bought this book with his Skeat Prize money in Spring [[1914]].<ref name=C51/>
*[[1913]]: ''A Welsh Grammar Historical and Comparative: Phonology and Accidence''

*Description: Tolkien bought this book with his Skeat Prize money in Spring [[1914]] (the book includes the inscriptions "1914" and "Skeat Prize Vol. 3"). Tolkien added several marginal notes and corrections. On page 33
column2: Tolkien noted "I have heard it in 1920"
column3: in reaction to Morris-Jones's remark that while the spelling  ''ychain'' for Welsh ''[[Wiktionary:ychen|ychen]]'' ("oxen") is wrongly derived
column4: the form ''ychain'' can be heard in [[Wikipedia:Gwynedd|Gwynedd]].<ref name=TW/><ref name=C51>{{CG|C}}
